items.content: The two children killed in the shooting have been identified as Fletcher Merkel, eight, and Harper Moyski, 10.

items.title: Here's what we know about the Minneapolis school shooting
items.standfirst: Two children were killed and 18 other people were injured when the shooter opened fire at Annunciation Catholic Church during a Mass.
items.content: Two children were killed and 18 other people were injured when the shooter opened fire at Annunciation Catholic Church during a Mass.

items.title: Victims identified in Minneapolis school shooting
items.standfirst: The two children killed in the Annunciation Catholic School shooting in Minneapolis have been identified by family. NBC News’ Maggie Vespa reports on the latest in the case that shocked the country.
items.content: The two children killed in the Annunciation Catholic School shooting in Minneapolis have been identified by family. NBC News’ Maggie Vespa reports on the latest in the case that shocked the country.

items.title: Minneapolis officials call for stronger gun laws after school shooting
items.standfirst: The shooter in Minneapolis fired more than 100 rounds from a rifle at the church where students at Annunciation Catholic School attended Mass. City and state officials highlighted this fact as they called for stricter gun control. Ash-har Quraishi has more.
items.content: The shooter in Minneapolis fired more than 100 rounds from a rifle at the church where students at Annunciation Catholic School attended Mass. City and state officials highlighted this fact as they called for stricter gun control. Ash-har Quraishi has more.

items.title: Families of 2 killed in Minneapolis school shooting issue statements
items.standfirst: The families of the two children who were shot and killed early Wednesday morning at Annunciation Catholic Church in southwest Minneapolis spoke out for the first time Thursday afternoon.
items.content: The families of the two children who were shot and killed early Wednesday morning at Annunciation Catholic Church in southwest Minneapolis spoke out for the first time Thursday afternoon.

items.title: Minneapolis mourns 2 children killed in Catholic school shooting
items.standfirst: Minneapolis is beginning the long healing process in the wake of the country's latest school shooting. Mourners gathered outside the Catholic school where two students were killed on Wednesday. Special Correspondent Fred De Sam Lazaro reports.
items.content: Minneapolis is beginning the long healing process in the wake of the country's latest school shooting. Mourners gathered outside the Catholic school where two students were killed on Wednesday. Special Correspondent Fred De Sam Lazaro reports.

items.content: Fletcher Merkel, 8, was one of two children killed in Wednesday's shooting at Annunciation Catholic School in Minneapolis.

items.title: Middle schoolers are lauded for protecting younger kids during church shooting
items.standfirst: Harper Moyski, age 10, and Fletcher Merkel, age 8, were killed, and 18 children between the ages 6 and 15 were injured by a shooter. Middle schoolers acted heroically to protect others, a parent said.
items.content: Harper Moyski, age 10, and Fletcher Merkel, age 8, were killed, and 18 children between the ages 6 and 15 were injured by a shooter. Middle schoolers acted heroically to protect others, a parent said.(Image credit: Stephen Maturen)

items.title: Boy and girl killed in US Catholic school shooting named
items.standfirst: The families of two children killed in the US Catholic school shooting have said their "hearts are broken" and branded the attacker a "coward".
items.content: The families of two children killed in the US Catholic school shooting have said their "hearts are broken" and branded the attacker a "coward".

items.title: Minneapolis school shooting: police say locked doors saved ‘countless lives’
items.standfirst: Shooter tried to enter church to carry out attack but failed since doors had been locked when mass began, officials sayAs Minneapolis grappled with the aftermath of the mass shooting at a Catholic school church in which two children were killed and 17 people injured, police said “countless lives” had been saved by the church doors being locked as the shooter had not been able to get inside.Two children, aged eight and 10, were killed in the church pews during morning mass at the Annunciation Catholic school church. Fourteen other children, aged six to 15, were also injured, two of them critically, though officials said they were expected to survive. Three adults, parishioners in their 80s, were also injured. Police said the suspect, Robin Westman, 23, killed themself and was found dead behind the church. Continue reading...
items.content: Shooter tried to enter church to carry out attack but failed since doors had been locked when mass began, officials sayAs Minneapolis grappled with the aftermath of the mass shooting at a Catholic school church in which two children were killed and 17 people injured, police said “countless lives” had been saved by the church doors being locked as the shooter had not been able to get inside.Two children, aged eight and 10, were killed in the church pews during morning mass at the Annunciation Catholic school church. Fourteen other children, aged six to 15, were also injured, two of them critically, though officials said they were expected to survive. Three adults, parishioners in their 80s, were also injured. Police said the suspect, Robin Westman, 23, killed themself and was found dead behind the church. Continue reading...

items.content: Two young children were killed and 18 others were injured in a shooting during a Catholic Mass packed with young students in south Minneapolis Wednesday morning. The shooter is also dead.

items.standfirst: US president spent months waging campaign against Fed’s leaders, which has raised questions over its independenceThe Federal Reserve governor Lisa Cook has filed a lawsuit against Donald Trump over his “unprecedented and illegal attempt” to fire her, calling it an attempt to undermine the central bank’s independence.The lawsuit – filed by Cook in federal court in Washington on Thursday – sets the stage for a legal battle over the US president’s extraordinary push for greater control of the central bank. items.content: The three powers trigger a process which could restore sanctions in 30 days, calling Iran's nuclear programme a threat to peace and security.

items.title: Why European countries want to reimpose harsh sanctions on Iran

items.content: France, Germany, and the UK are starting a 30-day process to reimpose sanctions on Iran over its nuclear programme.

items.content: Britain, France and Germany launched a 30-day process to reimpose U.N. sanctions on Iran over its nuclear programme on Thursday, according to a letter sent by the three nations to the U.N.

items.content: The UK, France and Germany are planning to revive UN-backed sanctions on Iran over fears it is developing nuclear weapons.

They accuse Iran of breaking commitments related to its nuclear program.
The move follows the 2015 Iran nuclear deal.
The countries are concerned about Iran developing nuclear weapons.

items.standfirst: Russian missiles and drones ripped through apartment blocks in the Ukrainian capital Kyiv early Thursday, killing at least 21 people, including four children, an attack that President Volodymyr Zelensky said showed Moscow's rejection of peace negotiations. FRANCE 24's Emmanuelle Chaze reports from Kyiv.
items.content: Russian missiles and drones ripped through apartment blocks in the Ukrainian capital Kyiv early Thursday, killing at least 21 people, including four children, an attack that President Volodymyr Zelensky said showed Moscow's rejection of peace negotiations. items.title: Deadly Russian strike hits central Kyiv
items.standfirst: A “massive” Russian assault on Kyiv early Thursday resulted in the deaths of at least 12 people and left dozens more injured, according to Ukrainian officials. Powerful explosions rocked the Ukrainian capital during the night, illuminating the sky and sending a column of smoke into the air as emergency services raced to the affected areas. France24 Correspondent Emmanuelle Chaze reports from Kyiv, Ukraine.

France24 Correspondent Emmanuelle Chaze reports from Kyiv, Ukraine.

clusters.title: White House picks Kennedy deputy Jim O’Neill to replace fired CDC chief
clusters.neutral_headline: White House Appoints Kennedy Deputy to Lead CDC

items.title: White House picks Kennedy deputy Jim O’Neill to replace fired CDC chief
items.standfirst: Deputy health secretary chosen as agency’s interim director after firing of Susan MonarezWho’s who in the CDC crisis?The White House has chosen a deputy of Robert F Kennedy Jr to serve as the acting head of the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), a decision that comes as the standoff over the firing of director Susan Monarez has deepened, with Monarez’s lawyers claiming she will not depart unless Donald Trump himself removes her.A White House official confirmed to the Guardian that Jim O’Neill, currently the deputy secretary of the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), had been selected to temporarily lead the public health agency, giving Kennedy an ally in his efforts to overhaul US vaccine policy. Continue reading...
items.content: Deputy health secretary chosen as agency’s interim director after firing of Susan MonarezWho’s who in the CDC crisis?The White House has chosen a deputy of Robert F Kennedy Jr to serve as the acting head of the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), a decision that comes as the standoff over the firing of director Susan Monarez has deepened, with Monarez’s lawyers claiming she will not depart unless Donald Trump himself removes her.A White House official confirmed to the Guardian that Jim O’Neill, currently the deputy secretary of the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), had been selected to temporarily lead the public health agency, giving Kennedy an ally in his efforts to overhaul US vaccine policy. Continue reading...

items.title: Who is Jim O’Neill? CDC chief set to bolster RFK Jr plan to remake vaccine policy
items.standfirst: Ally of health secretary worked as speechwriter in George W Bush administration and has no training in medicineThe White House has chosen a top aide to health secretary Robert F Kennedy Jr to temporarily lead the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention – an appointment that is expected to bolster Kennedy’s goals of remaking federal vaccine policy.Jim O’Neill, a biotech investor and speechwriter for the health department during the George W Bush administration, as acting director of the agency that oversees vaccine recommendations, a White House official confirmed to the Guardian. Continue reading...
items.content: Ally of health secretary worked as speechwriter in George W Bush administration and has no training in medicineThe White House has chosen a top aide to health secretary Robert F Kennedy Jr to temporarily lead the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention – an appointment that is expected to bolster Kennedy’s goals of remaking federal vaccine policy.Jim O’Neill, a biotech investor and speechwriter for the health department during the George W Bush administration, as acting director of the agency that oversees vaccine recommendations, a White House official confirmed to the Guardian. Continue reading...

clusters.title: UN votes to end its peacekeeping operations in Lebanon next year after nearly 5 decades
clusters.neutral_headline: UN Votes to End Lebanon Peacekeeping Operations

items.title: UN votes to end its peacekeeping operations in Lebanon next year after nearly 5 decades
items.standfirst: The U.N. Security Council voted unanimously on Thursday to terminate the U.N. peacekeeping force in southern Lebanon at the end of next year after nearly five decades, bowing to demands from the United States and its close ally Israel.
items.content: The U.N. Security Council voted unanimously on Thursday to terminate the U.N. peacekeeping force in southern Lebanon at the end of next year after nearly five decades, bowing to demands from the United States and its close ally Israel.

items.title: UN Security Council votes to end peacekeeping force in Lebanon after 2026
items.standfirst: Bowing to US and Israeli demands, the UN Security Council voted unanimously on Thursday to terminate the multinational peacekeeping force in southern Lebanon. The resolution gives the force, known as UNIFIL, a year starting on Dec. 31, 2026, to withdraw its 10,800 military and civilian personnel and all UN equipment.
items.content: Bowing to US and Israeli demands, the UN Security Council voted unanimously on Thursday to terminate the multinational peacekeeping force in southern Lebanon. The resolution gives the force, known as UNIFIL, a year starting on Dec. 31, 2026, to withdraw its 10,800 military and civilian personnel and all UN equipment.

items.title: UN Security Council votes to wind down UNIFIL mission in Lebanon after 2026
items.standfirst: Amid US pressure, vote extends peacekeeping mission but then calls for 'orderly and safe drawdown and withdrawal'.
items.content: Amid US pressure, vote extends peacekeeping mission but then calls for 'orderly and safe drawdown and withdrawal'.

ai_summary: The UN Security Council voted to end peacekeeping in Lebanon.
The force will be terminated at the end of next year.
The decision follows demands from the US and Israel.
The force has been in place for nearly five decades.
The resolution calls for an orderly withdrawal.

The barrage, the deadliest assault on the Ukrainian capital since the Alaska meeting between US President Donald Trump…
items.content: Furious European officials summoned their Russian envoys after Moscow’s drone and missile strikes on Kyiv killed at least 21 people and damaged British and European Union offices. The barrage, the deadliest assault on the Ukrainian capital since the Alaska meeting between US President Donald Trump…

items.title: UK and EU summon top Russian diplomats after strikes hit British Council and EU offices in deadly attack on Kyiv - as it happened
items.standfirst: Overnight raid kills more than a dozen people as European leaders condemn ‘deliberate’ targeting of civilians and institutionsUkrainian prime minister Yulia Svyrydenko has now responded to the overnight Russian attacks on Kyiv, criticising Moscow for “horrific and deliberate killing of civilians.”“The Russians are not choosing to end the war, only constant expansion of atrocities,” she said.“Overnight in Kyiv, dozens of buildings were hit: residential houses, office centers, civilian enterprises. Among them also the building where the European Union Delegation to Ukraine is located. Russians now believe that they have paralyzed Ukraine’s allies with feigned plans for ‘negotiations’ and endless delays that only serve as methods to buy time with the true goal only of preventing sanctions.“My thoughts are with all those affected by the senseless Russian strikes on Kyiv which have damaged the British Council building. Putin is killing children and civilians, and sabotaging hopes of peace. Continue reading...
items.content: Overnight raid kills more than a dozen people as European leaders condemn ‘deliberate’ targeting of civilians and institutionsUkrainian prime minister Yulia Svyrydenko has now responded to the overnight Russian attacks on Kyiv, criticising Moscow for “horrific and deliberate killing of civilians.”“The Russians are not choosing to end the war, only constant expansion of atrocities,” she said.“Overnight in Kyiv, dozens of buildings were hit: residential houses, office centers, civilian enterprises. Among them also the building where the European Union Delegation to Ukraine is located. Russians now believe that they have paralyzed Ukraine’s allies with feigned plans for ‘negotiations’ and endless delays that only serve as methods to buy time with the true goal only of preventing sanctions.“My thoughts are with all those affected by the senseless Russian strikes on Kyiv which have damaged the British Council building. Putin is killing children and civilians, and sabotaging hopes of peace. Continue reading...

items.title: At least 21 dead in overnight Kyiv attack as UK and EU summon Russian envoys
items.standfirst: Missile strikes on Ukrainian capital hit EU and British Council offices in deadliest assault in monthsThe UK and European Union have summoned their Russian envoys after overnight missile strikes on Kyiv killed at least 21 people and damaged the city’s British Council and EU offices, in the deadliest aerial assault on the Ukrainian capital since the Alaska summit between Vladimir Putin and Donald Trump.Four children were among those killed after a residential building in the eastern Darnytskyi district was struck in the middle of the night, according to Ukraine’s interior minister, Ihor Klymenko. Continue reading...
items.content: Missile strikes on Ukrainian capital hit EU and British Council offices in deadliest assault in monthsThe UK and European Union have summoned their Russian envoys after overnight missile strikes on Kyiv killed at least 21 people and damaged the city’s British Council and EU offices, in the deadliest aerial assault on the Ukrainian capital since the Alaska summit between Vladimir Putin and Donald Trump.Four children were among those killed after a residential building in the eastern Darnytskyi district was struck in the middle of the night, according to Ukraine’s interior minister, Ihor Klymenko. Continue reading...

items.title: Russian missile and drone attack on Kyiv kills at least 18 people
items.standfirst: Zelenskyy says Moscow ‘chooses ballistics instead of the negotiating table’ after strikes on more than 20 locations• Europe live – latest updatesRussian airstrikes on Kyiv have killed at least 18 people and wounded dozens in the most deadly night raid on the Ukrainian capital since the Alaska summit between Vladimir Putin and Donald Trump.Seventeen people were reported killed when a five-storey residential building in the eastern Darnytskyi district was struck in the middle of the night, said Svitlana Vodolaha, a spokesperson for the state rescue service. Continue reading...
items.content: Zelenskyy says Moscow ‘chooses ballistics instead of the negotiating table’ after strikes on more than 20 locations• Europe live – latest updatesRussian airstrikes on Kyiv have killed at least 18 people and wounded dozens in the most deadly night raid on the Ukrainian capital since the Alaska summit between Vladimir Putin and Donald Trump.Seventeen people were reported killed when a five-storey residential building in the eastern Darnytskyi district was struck in the middle of the night, said Svitlana Vodolaha, a spokesperson for the state rescue service. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Missile and drone strikes on Kyiv killed at least 21 people.
The attacks damaged British Council and European Union offices.
The UK and EU summoned Russian envoys in response.
The strikes are the deadliest in Kyiv since the Alaska summit.
Ukrainian officials criticized the attacks as deliberate targeting of civilians.

items.title: Trump imposes 50% tariff on India as punishment for buying Russian oil
items.standfirst: US president has argued New Delhi indirectly helping fund Ukraine war as experts say move is ‘own goal’ against allyDonald Trump imposed 50% tariffs on most US imports from India, making good on a threat to punish one of the world’s largest economies over its purchases of discounted Russian oil.The tariffs, which came into effect just after midnight on Wednesday in Washington, risk inflicting significant damage on the Indian economy and further disrupting global supply chains. Continue reading...
items.content: US president has argued New Delhi indirectly helping fund Ukraine war as experts say move is ‘own goal’ against allyDonald Trump imposed 50% tariffs on most US imports from India, making good on a threat to punish one of the world’s largest economies over its purchases of discounted Russian oil.The tariffs, which came into effect just after midnight on Wednesday in Washington, risk inflicting significant damage on the Indian economy and further disrupting global supply chains. Continue reading...
